definition[0]: to stay where you are and do nothing until something finishes, especially something boring or unpleasant
example[0]: She had two weeks to sit it out while she waited to hear if she had got the job.
example[1]: She was prepared to sit out the years of Jack’s jail sentence.
definition[1]: to not take part in something, especially a game or dance, when you usually take part
example[2]: Johnson sat out the game with a shoulder injury.
